result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Not on the record.  DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  No other appearances.  DA will file motion to dismiss.
Status conference on March 13, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Niemeier.  No meeting set up yet.  DA says he will file guardianship tomorrow, if proposed guardian will accept.  Court asked DA to set up meeting with Attorney Niemeier.  STC set for 3/13 at 3 pm.
Status conference on February 6, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Status conference on January 9, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Niemeier.  Defense not challenging the forensic unit finding.  Found not competent by the court.  Not likely to regain competency within the time limits.  Ordered commited to the Dept of Human Services.  Bond continued.  This finding covers all open cases.  STC on 1/9 at 3:00 pm.  All cases.
and gave copy to DA  (Per C.O. - Judge has a copy)
from Defendant's mother to Attorney Poss.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  State going to file a Chapter 54.   Defendant is on an ankle monitor.  Court reminded defendant no alcohol, or possession.  Ankle monitor may be removed.  Clerk to revew.
Status conference on August 8, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  Attorneys will contact Corporation Counsel tomorrow AM.
Status conference at 05-09-2016 03:00 pm

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared with Attorney Poss.  Parties have the January report.  Defendant found not competent, not likely to become competent.  May proceed with a guardianship.  Attorney Poss will talk to Corp. Counsel.  Keep cases active for now.  STC set for 5/9/16 at 3 pm.  Bond continued.
paper copy given to DA & defense attorney.  E-mailed to Judge Becker.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  State does not contest competency plan.  Re-evaluation report due 1/26.  Attorney Poss says defendant is actively engaged in the plan.  STC set for 2/8/16 at 3 pm.
Letter from the Outpatient Competency Restoration Program.
Status conference at 02-01-2016 03:00 pm
of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency)

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  Discussion on competency issue.  Attorney Poss has paperwork from Lutheran Social Services.  State does not contest the findings of the competency evaluation.  Attorney Poss will prepare an order for the court.  Court found the defendant incompetent, but likely to regain competency.  STC set for 11/16/15 at 3 pm
Status conference at 10-26-2015 03:00 pm

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion for Attorney Poss.  Working on a outpatient plan with HCN.  Parties to put information together to present to the evaluator.  Set hearing end of October or early November, and have evaluator appear by phone.  1/2 hour - 45 min.  competency hearing.  Discussion on whether need neuro-psychological evaluation.  10/26/15 at 3 pm.  Bond continued.
for Competency Examination by DHS.
Competency hearing at 09-28-2015 03:30 pm

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  Attorney Poss is not ready to plead today.  Requests competency evaluation.  Due 9/18.  Competency hearing 9/28/15 at 3:30 pm.  Evaluator to have access to  RIP files.  Bond continued.
of D.B.
Restitution worksheet
to defendant's mother.
from defendant's mother.  Copies given to Attorneys Poss & Fox
Plea hearing at 08-10-2015 10:30 am
Plea hearing at 07-29-2015 10:30 am

Defendant appeared at 1:00 with counsel SPD Paul Fredrickson who appeared specially for William Poss.  DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defense is requesting a bond modificatioin to reduce the cash bond but the conditions remain as they are.  DA Fox has no objection to redue.  Court orders cash bond reduced to $100 with same conditions.  Balance of bond can be refunded to poster.

No appearance by defendant at 10:30 but counsel SPD Paul Fredrickson, appeared specially for William Poss.  DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  All his open cases will be rescheduled to 7-29-15 at 10:30.

This bond includes cases 15CF55, 15CF7, 15CF16, and 14CT99:  Cash bond posted on 15CF7 2/5/2015 applies to this bond. AMENDED 6/15/2015 Cash bond reduced from $500 to $100.    Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: the victim in 15CF7.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin. Mr. Joseph Cholka is to have home detention from 8:00 p.m. to 7:00 a.m. unless hospitalized or medical appointment, or legal appointments.  He is to go directly to and from those appointments.  He is to be fitted with a SCRAM unit before release and must return daily to the Jackson County Sheriff's Department between 8:00 a.m. and 10:00 a.m. Jail will prompt Mr Cholka by calling him to come in.  The SCRAM unit is not to be removed without the court's prior permission.  If defendan violates the bond conditions he is to be held in jail until he can be brought before the court.  AMENDED 4/1/15.  On April 2, 2015 from noon until his dental appointment is done, the SCRAM may be removed.  He must immediately return to the Sheriff's Dept. to have it put back on.  He must not leave the Sheriff's Dept until the SCRAM unit is put back on.  On April 15, 2015 from 11:00 a.m. until his dental appointment is done, the SCRAM may be removed.  He must immediately return to the Sheriff's Dept to have it put back on.  He must not leave the Sheriff's Dept until the SCRAM unit is put back on.

DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person, without counsel.  Defendant did not contact SPD yet.  Court advised defendant that these are serious charges.  Defendant will hire an attorney.  Court told defendant to contact SPD in the meantime, and he can continue to pursue hiring his own attorney.  Bond continued.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals: victim Mr. Brown.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.
Adjourned initial appearance at 02-02-2015 09:30 am
